title: TC001-Sign up as Professor with valid details redirects to professor dashboard
description: Verifies a new user can create a Professor account and is redirected to the Professor dashboard after successful sign up.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5500
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5500", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Sign up' link on the login page to open the signup form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/p/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Fill the signup form with the provided Professor details, select Professor role, and click Sign Up (then verify redirect). Immediate action: input Full Name.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Test Professor One')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('UPROF-260223-001')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[3]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('test.prof.one.260223@example.com')
        
        # -> Input the password into the Password field, select the Professor role, and click the Sign Up button to submit the form (then verify redirect to /professor/dashboard).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[4]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('ValidPass!234')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[2]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        assert '/professor/dashboard' in frame.url
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
TEST FAILURE

ASSERTIONS:
- Sign up did not redirect to /professor/dashboard; current URL remains /signup.
- 'fetch failed' error message is displayed on the signup page after submitting the form.
- The Sign Up form is still visible with populated fields, indicating account creation did not succeed.
- No success confirmation or dashboard content was observed after submission.

title: TC002-Sign up as Student with valid details redirects to student dashboard
description: Verifies a new user can create a Student account and is redirected to the Student dashboard after successful sign up.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5500
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5500", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Sign up' link to open the signup page so the signup form can be filled.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/p/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Fill the signup form with the student's details (Full Name, University ID, Email, Password), select Student role, then click Sign Up to submit. After submit, verify redirect to /student/dashboard.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Test Student One')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('USTUD-260223-001')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[3]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('test.stud.one.260223@example.com')
        
        # -> Type 'ValidPass!234' into the Password field (index 223), select the Student role (index 229), then click the Sign Up button (index 246) to submit the form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[4]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('ValidPass!234')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[1]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        assert '/student/dashboard' in frame.url
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
TEST FAILURE

ASSERTIONS:
- User not redirected to /student/dashboard after submitting the signup form
- 'fetch failed' error message is displayed on the signup page
- Signup form remains visible with inputs prefilled, indicating account creation did not complete

title: TC003-Missing university ID shows required field validation errors
description: Verifies the University ID field is required and validation errors are visible when submitting an empty University ID.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5500
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5500", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Sign up' link on the login page to open the registration form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/p/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Clear the University ID field, fill Full Name, Email, Password, select Student role, then click Sign Up to submit the form (to trigger validation for empty University ID).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Missing ID Student')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[3]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('missing.id.student.260223@example.com')
        
        # -> Fill the Password field with 'ValidPass!234', select the Student role, then click the Sign Up button to submit the form and trigger validation for the empty University ID.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[4]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('ValidPass!234')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[1]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC004-Submitting empty form shows validation errors for required fields
description: Verifies client-side/server-side validations display required-field errors when submitting with all fields empty.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5500
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5500", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Sign up' link on the login page (interactive element index 91) to open the signup page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/p/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Sign Up' button to submit the empty signup form (index 261) so validation errors can be observed.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Full Name').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=University ID').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Email').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Password').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=required').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC005-Invalid email format is rejected with a visible validation message
description: Verifies the sign up form rejects an invalid email format and shows a visible validation error.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5500
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5500", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Sign up' link to open the signup form so the test can fill the form and submit an invalid email.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/p/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Fill the Full Name field with 'Invalid Email User' (input index 226) then fill University ID (index 230), Email (index 234) with 'not-an-email', Password (index 238) with 'ValidPass!234', select Student role (click index 244), and submit the form (click index 261). After submission, check for visible validation text 'invalid email'.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Invalid Email User')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('UEMAIL-260223-001')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[3]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('not-an-email')
        
        # -> Type the password into the Password field (index 238), select the Student role (index 244), click Sign Up (index 261) to submit, then check for a visible validation message containing 'invalid email'.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[4]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('ValidPass!234')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[1]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Verify whether a validation message containing 'invalid email' is present among known elements; if not, report the missing feature
        found = False
        xpaths = [
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/input',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[3]/input',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[4]/input',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[1]',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[1]/button',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[1]/div',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[1]/div/span',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[2]',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[2]/button',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[2]/div',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[2]/div/span',
            '/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/p/a',
            '/html/body/section',
         ]
        # short pause to allow any validation message to render
        await page.wait_for_timeout(500)
        for xp in xpaths:
            locator = frame.locator(f"xpath={xp}")
            # Try to read a value attribute (for inputs / buttons)
            try:
                val = await locator.get_attribute('value')
            except Exception:
                val = None
            if val and 'invalid email' in val.lower():
                found = True
                break
            # Try text content / visible text
            try:
                txt = await locator.text_content()
            except Exception:
                txt = None
            if txt and 'invalid email' in txt.lower():
                found = True
                break
        if not found:
            raise AssertionError("Validation message 'invalid email' not found on page; feature may be missing")
        # If found, pass (test considered successful for this assertion)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC006-Short/weak password is rejected with a visible validation message
description: Verifies password requirements are enforced and a visible error appears for an invalid/weak password.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5500
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5500", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Sign up' link to open the signup page.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/p/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Fill the form with the test user (Weak Password User) and submit the form by clicking 'Sign Up'. After submit, verify that the validation messages containing the text 'password' and 'too short' are visible.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('Weak Password User')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('UPASS-260223-001')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[3]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('weak.pass.260223@example.com')
        
        # -> Input the password '123' into the Password field (index 238) as the immediate action.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[4]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('123')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[1]/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=password').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=too short').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC007-Role not selected prevents sign up and shows a visible error

        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5500
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5500", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Click the 'Sign up' link to open the signup page so the form can be filled.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/p/a').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Fill the signup form (Full Name, University ID, Email, Password) and submit without selecting a role to check for a validation message indicating role is required.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('No Role User')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('UROLE-260223-001')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[3]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('no.role.260223@example.com')
        
        # -> Type the password into the Password field (index 210) and click the 'Sign Up' button (index 233) to submit the form without selecting a role, so the page can be checked for a 'required' validation message.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[4]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('ValidPass!234')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Assert that the role selection control (radiogroup) is present and visible
        role_group = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div')
        assert await role_group.is_visible(), "Role selection (radiogroup) is not visible on the signup page"
        
        # Assert that the individual role options are visible (Student and Professor)
        student_label = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[1]')
        professor_label = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[5]/div/label[2]')
        assert await student_label.is_visible(), "Student option label is not visible on the signup page"
        assert await professor_label.is_visible(), "Professor option label is not visible on the signup page"
        
        # The test plan requires verifying text "Role" and a "required" validation message are visible after submitting without selecting a role.
        # Neither an element containing the exact text "Role" nor any element containing the text "required" is present in the provided available elements list.
        # Report the missing feature/validation and mark the task as done.
        raise AssertionError("Expected text 'Role' or a 'required' validation message not found on the page. Feature/validation message appears to be missing. Task marked as done.")
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC008-Professor creates a consultation window and sees 15-minute open slots generated
description: Verifies a professor can create a consultation window and the system lists generated 15-minute slots with status 'open'.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5500
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5500", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Fill the email and password fields and click the Sign In button to log in as a professor.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('example@gmail.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('password123')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Retry clicking the 'Sign In' button to attempt login again. If the error persists after this retry, report the site issue and finish the test with failure.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Professor').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Create Consultation Window').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=open').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=10:00').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=10:15').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())
testError:
TEST FAILURE

ASSERTIONS:
- Login failed - 'fetch failed' error message displayed after attempting to sign in.
- Professor dashboard not reached - no redirect to /professor/dashboard observed after sign in attempts.
- Sign-in remained in loading state ('Signing inâ€¦') indicating the authentication request did not complete.
- Credentials were entered and submitted correctly, so the failure appears to be server-side or network-related.

title: TC010-Student attempting to access professor dashboard is denied or redirected
description: Verifies role-based access control prevents an authenticated student from using the professor dashboard.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5500
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5500", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Fill the email and password fields with the test credentials and submit the login form.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('example@gmail.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('password123')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Wait for the sign-in to finish (if still in progress), then navigate to /professor/dashboard to test access control.
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5500/professor/dashboard", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Verify that an "Access denied" message is visible (use the notifications section xpath from available elements)
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/section').nth(0)
        await elem.wait_for(state='visible', timeout=5000)
        text = (await elem.inner_text()).strip()
        assert "Access denied" in text, f"Expected 'Access denied' in notification, got: {text!r}"
        
        # Verify that the user was redirected to the student dashboard URL
        assert "/student/dashboard" in frame.url, f"Expected redirect to '/student/dashboard' but current URL is: {frame.url}"
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

asyncio.run(run_test())

title: TC015-Booked slot becomes disabled as 'Your Booking' to prevent re-booking
description: Verifies that after booking a slot, the UI indicates it is the student's booking and it cannot be booked again.
code:
import asyncio
from playwright import async_api
from playwright.async_api import expect

async def run_test():
    pw = None
    browser = None
    context = None

    try:
        # Start a Playwright session in asynchronous mode
        pw = await async_api.async_playwright().start()

        # Launch a Chromium browser in headless mode with custom arguments
        browser = await pw.chromium.launch(
            headless=True,
            args=[
                "--window-size=1280,720",         # Set the browser window size
                "--disable-dev-shm-usage",        # Avoid using /dev/shm which can cause issues in containers
                "--ipc=host",                     # Use host-level IPC for better stability
                "--single-process"                # Run the browser in a single process mode
            ],
        )

        # Create a new browser context (like an incognito window)
        context = await browser.new_context()
        context.set_default_timeout(5000)

        # Open a new page in the browser context
        page = await context.new_page()

        # Interact with the page elements to simulate user flow
        # -> Navigate to http://localhost:5500
        await page.goto("http://localhost:5500", wait_until="commit", timeout=10000)
        
        # -> Fill the login form with example@gmail.com / password123 and click Sign In to attempt to reach the student dashboard.
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[1]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('example@gmail.com')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Input text
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/div[2]/input').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.fill('password123')
        
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # -> Retry signing in by clicking the 'Sign In' button to attempt to reach /student/dashboard (second and final login attempt).
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        # Click element
        elem = frame.locator('xpath=/html/body/div[2]/div[2]/div[2]/form/button').nth(0)
        await page.wait_for_timeout(3000); await elem.click(timeout=5000)
        
        # --> Assertions to verify final state
        frame = context.pages[-1]
        assert '/student/dashboard' in frame.url
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Your Booking').first).to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await expect(frame.locator('text=Confirm Booking').first).not_to_be_visible(timeout=3000)
        await asyncio.sleep(5)

    finally:
        if context:
            await context.close()
        if browser:
            await browser.close()
        if pw:
            await pw.stop()

asyncio.run(run_test())

- Student dashboard not reached after two sign-in attempts; URL remains on /login
- Booking steps could not be executed because authentication did not complete
- Sign In button clicked twice with no successful redirect or new interactive elements indicating login
- Backend appears unreachable causing 'fetch failed' during authentication
